name: To Kill a Mockingbird
title: To Kill a Mockingbird
desc: A novel by Harper Lee published in 1960, instantly successful, widely read in high schools and middle schools in the United States.
A novel by George Orwell published in 1949 as a warning about the dangers of totalitarianism.

name: The Great Gatsby
title: The Great Gatsby
desc: A 1925 novel by American writer F. Scott Fitzgerald. It is set in the Jazz Age on Long Island, near New York City.

name: Brave New World
title: Brave New World
desc: A dystopian social science fiction novel and cautionary tale, written by the English writer Aldous Huxley, and published in 1932.

name: The Catcher in the Rye
title: The Catcher in the Rye
desc: A novel by J. D. Salinger, partially published in serial form in 1945–1946 and as a novel in 1951.

name: Moby Dick
title: Moby Dick
desc: An 1851 novel by Herman Melville. The story tells the adventures of wandering sailor Ishmael and his voyage on the whaleship Pequod, commanded by Captain Ahab.

name: War and Peace
title: War and Peace
desc: A novel by the Russian author Leo Tolstoy, first published from 1865 to 1869.

name: Crime and Punishment
title: Crime and Punishment
desc: A novel by the Russian author Fyodor Dostoevsky. It was first published in the literary journal The Russian Messenger in twelve monthly installments during 1866.

name: Pride and Prejudice
title: Pride and Prejudice
desc: A romantic novel of manners written by Jane Austen in 1813.

name: The Hobbit
title: The Hobbit
desc: A children's fantasy novel by English author J. R. R. Tolkien. It was published on 21 September 1937.

name: The Odyssey
title: The Odyssey
desc: An epic poem attributed to the ancient Greek poet Homer. It is, in part, a sequel to the Iliad, the other work ascribed to Homer.

name: The Iliad
title: The Iliad
desc: An ancient Greek epic poem attributed to Homer. It is set during the Trojan War, the ten-year siege of the city of Troy by a coalition of Greek states.

name: The Book Thief
title: The Book Thief
desc: A historical novel by Australian author Markus Zusak, and is his most popular work.

name: The Chronicles of Narnia
title: The Chronicles of Narnia
desc: A series of seven fantasy novels by British author C. S. Lewis.

name: Harry Potter
title: Harry Potter and the Sorcerer's Stone
desc: A fantasy novel written by British author J. K. Rowling.

name: Jane Eyre
title: Jane Eyre
desc: A novel by English writer Charlotte Brontë. It was published on 16 October 1847.

name: Animal Farm
title: Animal Farm
desc: An allegorical novella by George Orwell, first published in England on 17 August 1945.

name: The Little Prince
title: The Little Prince
desc: A novella by French aristocrat, writer, and aviator Antoine de Saint-Exupéry. It was first published in English and French in the United States in 1943.

name: The Lord of the Rings
title: The Lord of the Rings
desc: An epic high-fantasy novel written by English author and scholar J. R. R. Tolkien.

name: Great Expectations
title: Great Expectations
desc: A novel by Charles Dickens, first published in serial form in All the Year Round from 1 December 1860 to August 1861.

name: The Alchemist
title: The Alchemist
desc: A novel by Brazilian author Paulo Coelho that was first published in 1988.

name: Wuthering Heights
title: Wuthering Heights
desc: A novel by Emily Brontë published in 1847 under her pseudonym 'Ellis Bell'. It is her only finished novel.

name: The Picture of Dorian Gray
title: The Picture of Dorian Gray
desc: A philosophical novel by Oscar Wilde, first published complete in the July 1890 issue of Lippincott's Monthly Magazine.

name: Les Misérables
title: Les Misérables
desc: A French historical novel by Victor Hugo, first published in 1862, that is considered one of the greatest novels of the 19th century.

name: A Tale of Two Cities
title: A Tale of Two Cities
desc: A historical novel by Charles Dickens, set in London and Paris before and during the French Revolution.

name: Frankenstein
title: Frankenstein
desc: A novel written by English author Mary Shelley, telling the story of Victor Frankenstein, a young scientist who creates a sapient creature in an unorthodox scientific experiment.

name: Dracula
title: Dracula
desc: An 1897 Gothic horror novel by Irish author Bram Stoker. It introduced the character of Count Dracula and established many conventions of subsequent vampire fantasy.

name: Fahrenheit 451
title: Fahrenheit 451
desc: A 1953 dystopian novel by American writer Ray Bradbury. It is regarded as one of his best works.

name: One Hundred Years of Solitude
title: One Hundred Years of Solitude
desc: A landmark 1967 novel by Colombian author Gabriel García Márquez that tells the multi-generational story of the Buendía family.

name: The Grapes of Wrath
title: The Grapes of Wrath
desc: An American realist novel written by John Steinbeck and published in 1939. The book won the National Book Award and Pulitzer Prize for fiction.
